data.title: Films Featuring Latter-day Saint Actors
meta_keywords: movies; Mormons; LDS; films; Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints; Christian
data.meta_description: List of over 800 Latter-day Saint (Mormon) actors and actresses, and their film credits.
data.text:
This page lists film credits of Latter-day Saint actors. Films listed include primarily feature films, but also made-for-television movies (listed in this color), videos (identified with a "V"), and music videos ("mv"). Miniseries are indicated by the word "mini." Television series credits are listed on a separate page. Names and credits of actors who have had only smaller film roles are below. There is also a list of more Utah actors, particularly some lesser-known actors who live in Salt Lake City, Ogden or Park City.

Most of the films listed are mainstream productions, but films and videos made for the Latter-day Saint market, as well as Church-commissioned films and videos, are listed as well.

For some films, the actor's billing is indicated with "1b" for 1st/top billing, "2b" for 2nd billing, "3b" for 3rd billing, etc.

Some photographs and brief biographical sketches for selected major actors and actresses are available. Many more capsule biographies can be found here.

See also: Box Office Performance of Feature Films Starring Latter-day Saint Actors.

This is not a complete list, but it contains most of the information we have at this time.

Actors in Starring or Major Roles

Note: This section lists actors who have appeared in starring or major roles in films. After their major roles, other films are listed--in a smaller typeface--in which the actor has had a smaller role.

Bart Johnson: TV and film star

Actor Bart Johnson has spent more than 10 years working in film, television and theater. Perhaps his most memorable role was as "Nelson Tucker" on the TV series "Hyperion Bay".

Born in Hollywood, Calif., Johnson spent much of his early childhood on television sets with his mother, who has a hairstylist for shows including "Mork and Mindy" and "The Brady Bunch." He moved with his family from Los Angeles to Midway, Utah, When he was 12 years old

Johnson's first movie role was a cop in the feature film "Mi Familia," the epic story of an immigrant family produced by Francis Ford Coppola. He was also featured in "Double Jeopardy"; Richard Donner's "Maverick," starring Mel Gibson; and Francine McDugall's short film "The Date," which won Best Short and the Sundance Film Festival. On television, Johnson has guest starred on the series "Walker, Texas Ranger," "JAG," "Clueless," "Diagnosis Murder," "Babylon 5," and "Sunset Beach." On stage Johnson has been a guest performer and trained with the famous Groundings comedy troupe in Los Angeles and won rave reviews for his performances in "The Country Club," an award-winning stage production at L.A.'s Mojo Theater.

When not working, Johnson enjoys flying airplanes; surfing; mountain biking; kickboxing, which he studies with world champion kickboxer Billy Blanks; and playing football, skiing, soccer and basketball.
